item.title: Equanimity & Mental Toughness: How to Navigate Daily Life
item.description: Theory 1: Mental toughness is your ability to see the positive in every situation. This is because the alternative is a destructive spiral to the bottom of society. Binge watched two episodes of Netflix when you said you would sleep after one? Choice one: That’s ok, let me sleep now, at least I enjoyed it. Choice two: I’ve ruined everything, I’m going to wake up tired, I may aswell just keep watching.

item.title: Stop Trying to Be Happy
item.description: Let’s start with a quote. Buddhism teaches that “the root of all suffering is desire”. To have desires is to suffer is to be unhappy - but how does that help anyone? Should one just stop desiring? Alan Watts, an illustrious zen philosopher, converts these ideas into a simple philosophy on how to live: “The meaning of life is just to be alive. It is so plain and so obvious and so simple, and yet, everybody rushes around in a great panic as if it were necessary to achieve something beyond themselves.
